title: James Turrell’s volcanic masterpiece: a trip inside the crater with Kanye West’s favourite artist
text:
One thing unites Kanye West’s new album, Jesus is King, its companion film of the same name and the rapper’s recent philanthropy: the American artist James Turrell.

Turrell, 76, is best known for his giant land-art installation at Roden Crater, in the desert near Flagstaff, Arizona. It’s the location where West filmed Jesus is King, and features on the album's accompanying artwork.

Roden Crater has been under construction since 1979; it is still yet to be completed. West made a $10 million donation towards the project earlier this year, calling Turrell’s work “life changing” and declaring that soon “we all will live in Turrell spaces”.
